description: From barrel +â€Ž house. Originally used to refer specifically to a bar that served whiskey directly from the barrel.

entries.meaning: A rough and tumble drinking establishment.
(music) A loud, percussive type of blues piano suitable for noisy bars or taverns.
examples: A barrelhouse blues was being shouted over the stamping of feet on a wooden floor. Miss Grace, the good-time woman, had her usual Saturday-night customers.
